intro: Ranunculus auricomus subsp. dactylophyllus, commonly known as the golden shield or dactylophyllus buttercup, is a member of the Ranunculaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial characterized by its bright yellow flowers with five to eight petals. The leaves are typically trifoliate or palmately compound, with a distinctive lobed structure. This subspecies is native to Europe and parts of western Asia, often found in moist meadows and woodland edges. Its botanical features make it a notable ornamental plant in horticulture.
